properties.name: Pink Poui (Jayanagar)
properties.description: Tabebuia rosea all round the Shopping Complex

properties.name: Mahogany
properties.description: Mahogany (Swietenia macrophylla) lined avenue. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swietenia_macrophylla

properties.name: Millingtonia hortensis
properties.description: There a few of these trees remaining on the pavement.

properties.name: Rain Tree (Nanda Road)
properties.description: Nanda Road - as this road is often referred to, and the park flanking either side of the road forms, perhaps, one of the finest spectacles in Bangalore. The Rain Trees (Samanea saman) on either sides of the road forms a very nice avenue from South End circle to the other end. The parks on either side has a whole spectrum of trees besides the Rain Tree.With the work on Bangalore Metro underway, one wonders as to how many of these majestic trees will survive when the project is complete.

properties.name: Mahogany
properties.description: The Diagonal Road is also a good place to see and experience the Mahogany.

properties.name: Mahogany avenue
properties.description: Many are used as roosts by Common Mynas and House Crows. Opposite the Main Library.

properties.name: Parkia biglandulosa
properties.description: Large Parkia tree here.

properties.name: Colville's Glory
properties.description: A nice tree here - was in bloom in February 2008 or so.

properties.name: Akashmallige avenue
properties.description: Lots of Millingonia trees along the road here.

properties.name: In Memoriam
properties.description: Lovely avenue of Lagerstroemia - now gone. Maybe someone can add a link to old photographs of these.

properties.name: Golden divider
properties.description: This place in January-February is alight with the flowers of Tabebuia argentea. Great sight amid the traffic jams.

properties.name: Pink Tabebuia
properties.description: Not sure of the species, but this can be really brilliant when in bloom. Right at a traffic signal.  Actually Google maps has this tree in bloom !

properties.name: Java Cassia
properties.description: There are a couple of trees near the King's Statue... just follow the road within Cubbon Park (Aquarium towards Minsk Square) from the Queen's Statue to rech King's Statue.

properties.name: Ficus benjamina
properties.description: A large patch of these trees, one of the largest roosts of Rose-ringed Parakeets in this region.

properties.name: Tree of Gold
properties.description: The entrance gate to the Museum has a cluster of the Tabebuia argentea. Looks spectacular when all of them bloom en masse.

properties.name: Morton Bay Chestnut
properties.description: A few of the Castenospermum australe can be seen here.

properties.name: Akasha Mallige (Mini Forest)
properties.description: Lot of Millingonia trees in Mini Forest.

properties.name: Mast Tree
properties.description: The stretch from the gate to the parking lot of the Double Road entrance to Lalbagh is lined with Polyalthia. This tree can be seen used very effectively for planting on medians on many parts of the city.

properties.name: Queen's Flower
properties.description: When you face the bandstand standing in front of the Lalbagh Glass House you will see two of these trees on either side of the stairs leading down to the fountain.

properties.name: Pink Poui
properties.description: One of the finest individuals of Tababuia rosea stands here.

properties.name: Jacaranda and Gulmohur - Minsk Square
properties.description: The Minsk Square had Jacaranda and Gulmohur besides Polyalthia and a few other species. Now the Minsk Square itself has made way to development and so have the trees!!

properties.name: Mahogany Avenue
properties.description: Mahogany (Swietenia mahagoni) lined avenue with some really old trees. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swietenia_mahagoni

properties.name: Mahogany Avenue
properties.description: Mahogany (Swietenia mahagoni) lined main street that used to be the roost for a large number of birds. The Parakeets have disappeared, the Crows and Mynas still use some trees. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swietenia_mahagoni

properties.name: Elephant Ear Tree
properties.description: A very large tree, Elephant Ear Tree (Enterolobium cyclocarpum) is located at the edge of the playground opposite to the marriage hall. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enterolobium_cyclocarpum

properties.name: Pink Ipê or Pink Lapacho
properties.description: Tabebuia impetiginosa (avellanedae) is located at the two corners of this junction. They flower between January & March and are an impressive sight. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabebuia_impetiginosa

properties.name: Copper Pod Road
properties.description: Yellow poinciana or Copper Pod (Peltophorum pterocarpum) lined road. The long stretch of this road has these trees on either side. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peltophorum_pterocarpum

properties.name: Scarlet or Colored Sterculia
properties.description: Scarlet or Colored Sterculia (Sterculia colorata or Firmiana colorata) with 'velvet' covered flowers during March-April. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sterculia_colorata

properties.name: Elephant Ear Tree
properties.description: A very large tree, Elephant Ear Tree (Enterolobium cyclocarpum) is located at the edge of the park next to the Basavanagudi Police Station. Probably the largest of these trees in Bangalore! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enterolobium_cyclocarpum

properties.name: Krishna's Buttercup
properties.description: Krishna's Buttercup (Ficus krishnae) has very curiously shaped curled leaves. One of two/three trees located inside Lalbagh.

properties.name: Weeping Fig or Benjamin's Fig
properties.description: Weeping Fig or Benjamin's Fig (Ficus benjamina) bunch are located here. These are tall fig trees with small fruits and whitish bark. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ficus_benjamina

properties.name: Weeping Fig Avenue
properties.description: Weeping Fig or Benjamin's Fig (Ficus benjamina) avenue is located here. These are tall fig trees with small fruits and whitish bark. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ficus_benjamina

properties.name: Umbrella or Octopus Tree
properties.description: Umbrella or Octopus Tree (Schefflera actinophylla syn. Brassaia actinophylla) is a tree that has large palmate leaves and long flowers. Located near the Aquarium, this is one of the only places where this tree can be sighted in Lalbagh. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schefflera_actinophylla

properties.name: Sausage Tree
properties.description: Sausage Tree (Kigelia africana or pinnata) is a bat pollinated tree with hanging bunches of flowers and large sausage shaped pod bunches. A few of these trees can be found near this region. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kigelia

properties.name: Cannonball tree
properties.description: A nice Couroupita tree out here.

properties.name: Tabebuia argentea
properties.description: Wonder if those trees still grow ?

properties.name: Entada
properties.description: A really classic Entada scandens (?) liana. Had one at home but had to cut it due to the massive load they put on support structures. Hope the CES can bear this one. It is also commonly called the Giant Rattle. It is indeed nice to see these traversing the canopy of the forests where they occur.

properties.name: Bursera sp.
properties.description: The same tree that was grown in large numbers on the  Svetoslav Roerich's estate.

properties.name: Parkia biglandulosa
properties.description: Noticed here that the two glands (biglandulosa) that they appear to be extra-floral nectaries that are attended by ants.

properties.name: Pink Ipê or Pink Lapacho
properties.description: Tabebuia impetiginosa (avellanedae) is located on the road leading from the Glass House to Main Gate.

properties.name: Line of Pink Ipê or Pink Lapacho
properties.description: Tabebuia impetiginosa (avellanedae) is located on the road leading to the parking lot in front of the auditorium. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabebuia_impetiginosa

properties.name: African Tulip Tree
properties.description: African Tulip Tree (Spathodea campanulata) is a large tree with large tulip-shaped red flowers that come out in bunches. The bud of the flower is closed and contains water. The pod is sail-shaped and sticks out of the canopy. The seeds are embedded in a transparent plastic-cover-like floater that gets carried by the wind for dispersal. A lot of birds from Parakeets to Mynas frequent this tree to drink the water/nectar captured in the cup-shaped flowers. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spathodea_campanulata

properties.name: Rain Trees (IIMB)
properties.description: A lovely avenue of Rain Trees inside the IIMB campus.

properties.name: Silver Oak
properties.description: A series of Silver Oaks line the compound wall of Bangalore Club.

properties.name: Mast Tree
properties.description: A series of Mast trees line the compound wall of Bangalore Club after the series of Silver Oaks.

properties.name: Mast Tree
properties.description: The divider starting from Lalbagh going all the way till the start of the flyover has the Mast tree (Polyalthia longifolia var. longifolia).

properties.name: Temple Trees
properties.description: There a few Temple Trees (Plumeria sp.) of both red and white colours here.

properties.name: Nile Tulip Tree
properties.description: Nile Tulip Tree (Markhamia lutea or Dolichandrone platycalyx) has large yellow flowers and bunches of long hanging pods that are wavy in shape.

properties.name: Yellow Silk Cotton
properties.description: The Yellow Silk Cotton (Cochlospermum gossypium), a lone tree at the west gate entrance to Lalbagh.

properties.name: Kapok
properties.description: Kapok (Ceiba pentandra) is a very large silk cotton tree. This tree is probably the largest single-girth tree in Bagalore. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kapok

properties.name: Red Silk Cotton
properties.description: There are 2 Bombax trees on the opposite side of the cemetry.

properties.name: Pink Tabebuia
properties.description: You can actually see the blooms here.

properties.name: Enterolobium cyclocarpum
properties.description: These are large trees with a fine foliage. A part of the tree at the junction of Central Street and Cubbon Road fell a couple of years ago leaving behind a part of the tree.

properties.name: Wrightia tinctoria
properties.description: There are a couple of these trees near the smaller part of the lake in Lalbagh. When the tree puts forth small jasmine-like white flowers there is a lot of insect activity (bees and butterflies) around the tree.

properties.name: Guazuma ulmifolia
properties.description: A member of the Sterculia family. More on it The seeds look like those of casuarina. The avenue here has many of these trees and the electricity people keep trimming it down to prevent them from snagging the wires.

properties.name: Big Banyan
properties.description: This tree had a very large number of Rock bee hives (Claimed to be a local record once) and the entire area used to have a shade of yellow from the bee droppings.

properties.name: Caesalpinia coriaria
properties.description: Full of insects when in flower.

properties.name: Erythrina crista-galli.
properties.description: The dome is surrounded by Erythrina crista-galli.

properties.name: Cordia sebestena
properties.description: A lone tree of this species stands here i.e. the corner of 39th cross, Jayanagar 8th Block.

properties.name: Millingtonia hortensis
properties.description: A few of the Indian Cork Trees can be seen on the Kanakapura Road bordering the Yediyur Lake. Several can also on the road on the southern boundary of the lake where it is interspersed with the Nile Tulip Markhamia lutea.
